3.128. 
Obligations of the spouses after the division of the property when the marriage is not dissolved 
1. The spouse at whose request the property has been divided is obliged to contribute to the maintenance of the family household and to the upbringing and education of the children to the best of his/her ability. 
2. If the other spouse, for objective reasons, is unable to contribute to the upkeep of the family household and to the upbringing and education of the children, the spouse at whose request the property was divided must bear all such costs. 
3. In dividing the property, the court may order one spouse to pay to the other a sum of money out of which the latter shall pay to third parties all debts arising out of the marriage.
